p: This analysis investigated the complicated HIV-1 epidemic in Fuyang that was identified to have 14 subtypes within 1 year. In contrast with the result of a nationwide molecular epidemiological survey indicating CRF01_AE was the most prevalent strain in China after 2007, [ 28] it was found that CRF07_BC predominated in this area, followed by subtype B that accounted for as much as 31.77% of the strains. It is rare to have such a high proportion of subtype B after the early-mid 1990s when commercial plasma collection in central China resulted in an explosion of subtype B infections among former plasma donors (FPDs) [ 29]. According to a recent local HIV-1 epidemiologic survey, the epidemic in Fuyang was once affected by FPDs. It is now primarily driven by sexual contact transmission [ 11]. Therefore, these results suggested that subtype B strains had possibly spread out of the FPDs into the general population through sexual contact. This hypothesis is consistent with the result of our previous study conducted in Henan Province [ 30].
